items.author: Michael Wilmington
items.content: A stunner: a fiercely brilliant film of such wrenching impact, nonstop drive and unpredictability that watching it becomes an exhilarating ride.

items.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum
items.content: Fierce, loving, and electric, this movie's got bite as well as bark.

items.author: Desmond Ryan
items.content: An overpowering and original piece of bravura filmmaking that constitutes one of the most breathtaking and impressive directing debuts in years.

items.author: David Edelstein
items.content: The most enthralling movie of the year.

items.author: Mike Clark
items.content: The gritty, Oscar-nominated "Traffic" is a limo ride compared with the bloodletting in this year's foreign-film nominee from Mexico.

items.author: Jay Carr
items.content: As bloody as any recent film. But it's shot through with a harsh, stony humor that's invigorating enough to be regarded as a slap back at death.

items.author: Andrew O'Hehir
items.content: A feverish, breathtaking tour through Mexico City high and low, an explosive, mosaic-style portrait of our continent's largest city.
He (Gonzalez Inarritu) handles a complex plot with clarity and precision while keeping audience members on the edge of their seats.

items.author: Manohla Dargis
items.content: There's something overly studied, almost clinical, in how it all pulls together.

items.author: J. Hoberman
items.content: Undeniably high-powered. At 153 minutes, it's also punishingly overlong.
